problem_text:
Let F be a soluble saturated Fitting formation. Is it true that lF(G) ⩽ f(cF(G)), where cF(G) is the length of a composition series of some F-covering subgroup of a finite soluble group G? This is Problem 17 in (L. A. Shemetkov, Formations of Finite Groups, Moscow, Nauka, 1978 (Russian)). For the definition of the F-length lF(G), see ibid.
L. A. Shemetkov
